name: waive
content:

to not demand something you have a right to, or not cause a rule to be obeyed: The bank manager waived the charge (= said we didn't have to pay), as we were old and valued customers. If they waive (= remove) the time limit, many more applications will come in. He persuaded the delegates to waive (= give up) their objections. Compare
